cyclone.name: CLAUDETTE
cyclone.current_location: about 475 miles south of Morgan City, Louisiana
cyclone.trajectory: moving north toward the north-central Gulf Coast, then forecast to arc northeastward across the southeastern United States toward Georgia and the Carolinas
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: north-central Gulf Coast near the Louisiana coast (Intracoastal City–Morgan City area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: None for Georgia; watches confined to the northern Gulf Coast
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning from Intracoastal City, LA, to the Alabama/Florida border including Lake Pontchartrain, Lake Maurepas, and Metropolitan New Orleans
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast (Louisiana–Alabama) then inland through Mississippi, Alabama, Georgia, and the southern Appalachians
weather_observation.wind: Low probability (≤3%) of tropical-storm-force winds; breezy conditions possible late Sunday
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected along the Georgia coast
weather_observation.rainfall: Periods of heavy rain Sunday–Monday could total 4 inches or more with localized flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornado threat inland portions of Georgia; minor river rises possible
